root.title: Chaa-Hol III (e-15)
root.place: Monuments of this group were found in a valley near the river Chaa-Hol, the left inflow of Ulug-Hem, in 25 km above the mouth of river Hemchik. This district is on the bottom of water basin Sayano-Shushenskii now. All monuments of the group, except Е 15, are in museum exhibitions. Е 15 was found from district on left cost the river Chaa-Hol, in 8 km from its mouth.
root.store: The location of the stone is unknown now.
root.general: The stela is made of red-brown sandstone. According to message of Finno-Ugric scientific community "6 foots of height and 9 inches of width" 503, almost square in section, the surface is roughly squared.
root.description: The inscription of 3 lines, is located vertically on one face by all length of the stele. There is a tamga at foot.
